page.title: 10Liverpool Newsham,Media
page.content: It was found by all the schools in the Newsham Park area that newspapers are still widely bought.St. Sebastians school reported 87% of families buying a daily newspaper. Broadgreen and Birchfield reported that the Liverpool Echo was most popular. Of national papers the Sun and Daily Mirror were read most. Newsagents around Old Swan reported the Radio Times being the best selling magazine. Old Swan library is used by up to 500 people a day and has some 30,000 books, the highest category being fiction. All families had T.V. and 57% a video. Children watched on average 3.5 hours of T.V. a day, many houses had more than 1 set. ITV was the most popular channel. All schools found sport and comedy to be most popular,then films and soap operas.Radio was less liked, lead by pop music for listening to.
